Class World

  • java.lang.Object
    • World
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GlobalHelper

    public class World
extends java.lang.Object
implements GlobalHelper

    World

    Represents the entire game world

    Every other object in the main game frame is instantiated here. This includes the player, camera and map. Special emphasis is placed on the map, which is handled by and rendered inside the world class (while the other classes render for themselves). This class also calls the update and render methods for each of the other classes, including the Player, Items and Enemies, as well as the Panel, and could be considered the foundation class of the whole application.
    Since:
    2015-10-14
    Author:
    Daniel Porteous porteousd

      • getFriction

        public double getFriction(double x,
                          double y)
        Uses the position of the camera to find out where the player is. While the player object does have some notion of where it is on a global, pixel based scale, we will use the getcenterTile() method from the Camera class as this class has greater awareness its tile based position on the map. This position is then used to get the friction of the tile on which the player is using the getTileId() and getTileProperty() methods in previously instantiating TiledMap object, map.
        Parameters:
        x - In pixels. Horizontal x-coordinate position.
        y - In pixels. Vertical y-coordinate position.
        Returns:
        Returns a double between 0 and 1 giving friction at the target tile.
